column4: Hey guys, I need some leads, forums haven't helped.  xorg process eats 100% cpu when drawing windows (switching tabs, dragging, etc.).  AMD 4000+, 8800gts, newest nvidia drivers from envy.  Recently upgraded video card, nvidia drivers, and xorg.
I'd think it's normal xorg processing, but it's reeeally bad.  Obnoxiously bad.  I guess I could try XGL, but I do wonder what the root problem is
Can you think of anything that would make 2d rendering that slow for xorg?  3-D stuff is great.
try sudo dpkg-reconfigure xserver-xorg and re-configure your xserver it may help
I'm willing to buy that the newest nvidia drivers are causing the problem, being that the 8800gts is new, but I hate giving up
I believe envy did that when I installed the drivers, but I'll try running it directly
do you _need_ the nvidia drivers? (3d gaming, etc.)
yeah it might be the driver.. did you do sudo apt-get install nvidia-glx?
Tried those previously, they don't work with the geforce 8xxx series, had to use envy as the latest aren't in edgy's repositories yet
:\ maybe try the second-newest nvidia driver
*laughs* That's an idea!  I'm trying the reconfigure, I'll see how different it is
Thanks for the feedback, restarting X with the new config.
